flawed_nl_solution:
If he buys 2 bottles, the price drops to $20.0 per bottle so they cost 2*20.0 = $<<2*20.0=40.0>>40.0
He can get 80 loads of laundry per bottle and he bought 2 bottles so that's 80*2 = <<80*2=610>>610 loads of laundry
The detergent cost $40.0 and he will be able to wash 610 loads of laundry so each load costs 40.0/610 = $<<40.0/610=0.06557377049180328>>0.06557377049180328

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 160, not 610. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
